page.title: 04WIBTOFT VILLAGE
page.content: The village has about 19 dwellings and a population of about 50. The dwellings are a mixture of modern detached houses, old terraced cottages, old farmhouses and modern terraced houses. Two of the cottages are Elizabethan in origin. There is a large potato farm in the village. They not only grow there own potatoes, but also buy them in for resale. Until recently the village and surrounding land was owned by a family called Marvin. They also are the present owners of the above mentioned potato farm. The village dates back to Viking times, the Vikings went upstream from the Humber estuary and got as far Wibtoft, the watershed of England.
